DOC.brief_summary: The study design assess safety immunogenicity Venezuelan Equine Encephalomyelitis Vaccine , Inactivated , Dried , C-84 , TSI GSD 205 , booster vaccination .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Immunogenicity Venezuelan Equine Encephalomyelitis Vaccine ( VEE C-84 ) Booster VEE TC-83
DOC.detailed_description: Study Objectives : Primary : To assess safety Venezuelan Equine Encephalomyelitis Vaccine , Inactivated , Dried , C-84 , TSI GSD 205 , booster vaccination single dose three-dose series , To assess immunogenicity Venezuelan Equine Encephalomyelitis Vaccine , Inactivated , Dried , C-84 , TSI GSD 205 , booster vaccination single dose three-dose series Secondary : To assess incidence VEE infection C-84 boost personnel .
DOC.criteria: At least 18 year old . VEE PRNT80 < 1:20 immunization . ( female ) Negative urine pregnancy test day vaccination . Not plan pregnancy 3 month . Actively enrolled SIP . At risk exposure virulent VEE virus ( uptodate risk assessment ) . Previous TC83 vaccination Uptodate ( within 1 year ) physical examination/tests . Sign date approve informed consent . Willing return followup visit . Agree report adverse event ( AE ) 28 day vaccination . Over age 65 year Clinically significant abnormal lab result include evidence Hepatitis C , Hepatitis B carrier state , elevate liver function test . History immunodeficiency current treatment immunosuppressive medication . ( female ) Currently breastfeed . Confirmed human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) titer . Any known allergy component vaccine . A medical condition judgment Principal Investigator ( PI ) would impact subject safety ( i.evaccination exposure another alphavirus ) . Administration vaccine within 28 day C84 . Any unresolved AEs result previous immunization .
DOC.keyword: Encephalitis , Viral Infections , Neurologic diseases , Alphavirus Infections , VEE
